Key Match Events: Bénin lost their first match of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers against South Africa with a score of 1-2
Steve Mounié scored a goal for Bénin in the 70th minute to reduce the score to 2-1
Pre-Game Insights: The Bénin national football team is facing the Lesotho national team on November 21, 2023, in the second match of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers
The match is being played in Durban, South Africa, due to a lack of a homologated stadium in Lesotho
Post-Match Reflections: Gernot Rohr, the coach of the Bénin national football team, stated that they will not underestimate Lesotho after their performance against Nigeria
The Bénin team is looking to bounce back from their loss against South Africa
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lesotho national team drew with Nigeria in their first match of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers
Others: The match will take place at the Moses Mabhida Stadium in Durban, South Africa
The match is part of the second round of the 2026 World Cup qualifiers
